body: import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState } from "react";
// Defines the initial state for the theme context. It includes a default theme and a placeholder function for setting the theme.
// Creates a new React Context to share the theme state across the component tree.
children, // Represents the child components that will have access to the theme context.
defaultTheme = "system", // The default theme to use if no theme is found in local storage.
storageKey = "ui-theme", // The key used to store the theme preference in the browser's local storage.
// Initializes the theme state. It checks if the code is running on the client (browser) and if a theme preference exists in local storage.
// If a preference is found, it uses that; otherwise, it falls back to the default theme.
// An effect that runs whenever the 'theme' state changes to apply the selected theme to the HTML document.
// Detects the user's system-level dark mode preference.
// This function updates the local storage and the component's state with the new theme.
// The Context Provider makes the theme state and the setTheme function available to its children.
// A custom hook for consuming the theme context. It checks if the hook is used within the provider.
throw new Error("useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider");
Theme Provider Context.description: Creates a theme context provider component

body: import { createContext, useContext, useEffect, useState, type ReactNode } from "react";
// Defines a type alias for the possible theme values.
// Describes the shape of the context's value.
// Defines the props for the ThemeProvider component.
// Sets the initial state for the context.
// Creates the React Context with the defined type and initial state.
// Initializes the theme state from local storage or uses the default theme.
// A side effect to apply the selected theme to the HTML document.
// Detects the system's color scheme preference.
// Creates the value object to be provided by the context.
// Function to update local storage and the theme state.
// The provider component makes the value available to its children.
// A custom hook for consuming the theme context.
// Ensures the hook is used within the provider.
throw new Error("useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider");
Theme Provider Context with TypeScript.description: Creates a theme context provider component with TypeScript support
